author: Haris Iftikhar
description: A classic Italian-style pizza with a crisp crust, fresh tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, and basil — simple, fresh, and delicious.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil (for brushing the crust)
instructions: In a large bowl, mix flour, yeast, sugar, and salt.
Add warm water and olive oil, then knead until a soft dough forms.
Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rise for 1 hour or until doubled in size.
Roll out the dough on a floured surface into a round pizza base.
Spread pizza sauce evenly over the base, leaving a small border for the crust.
Top with shredded mozzarella and fresh basil leaves.
Brush the edges with olive oil for a golden crust.
Bake for 10–12 minutes or until the cheese melts and the crust turns golden brown.
Slice, serve hot, and enjoy your homemade Margherita pizza!
